label: AB2C4_oC28_64_a_f_ef-003
title: Base-Centered Orthorhombic La$_{2}$CuO$_{4}$ Structure
comments:
We have found three possible structures for La$_{2}$CuO$_{4}$, the parent compound of the high-temperature cuprate superconductors. 
 All are distortions of the tetragonal \href{current_web_home_dir/A4B2C_tI14_139_ce_e_a-001}{K$_{2}$NiF$_{4}$}/\href{current_web_home_dir/AB2C4_tI14_139_a_e_ce-001}{0201 [(La,Ba)$_{2}$CuO$_{4}$] High-T$_{c}$ Structure}, and reduce to that structure with doping of the lanthanum site: \begin{itemize} \item (Longo, 1973) proposed a \href{current_web_home_dir/AB2C4_oF28_69_a_g_cg-001}{face-centered orthorhombic structure}. \item Later other workers, including (Reehuis, 2006) and references therein, proposed a \href{current_web_home_dir/AB2C4_oC28_64_a_f_ef-003}{base-centered orthorhombic structure} (this structure). \item (Reehuis, 2006) found that a \href{current_web_home_dir/AB2C4_mC28_8_2a_4a_4a2b-001}{base-centered monoclinic structure} was a better fit to their neutron diffraction data. \end{itemize} ~ \vspace{-.25in} 
 As the two orthorhombic structures are both referenced in the literature, we present them, as well as the more recent monoclinic structure. 
 (Reehuis, 2006) gave the structure of the base-centered phase in the $Bmab$ setting of space group \#64.  We used FINDSYM to transform it to the standard $Cmca$ setting.
